description.lang: Aeon Labs Heavy Duty Smart Switch is a Z-Wave device that can report the wattage energy usage and KWH usage to a Z-Wave Controller (especially a gateway), it can be controlled by other Z-Wave devices to turn on/off loads, it can bear up to 40A current of resister loads. It also acts as a repeater that forward Z-Wave command messages to destination nodes if the originating controller is out of range from the destination node.By taking advantage of the Z-Wave mesh network, commands can be routed to their destination via intermediary listening Z-Wave products. Products that are Z-Wave certified can be used and communicate with other Z-Wave certified devices.
Group 1 is assigned to the Lifeline association group and every device has 5 nodes to associate.

When the Heavy Duty Smart Switch Gen5 receives the following commands, it will forward the commands to all node IDs (in Group 2).The command will be sent via multicast (if there are more than 2 Node IDs) or single-cast (if there is only one Node ID). Commands: Basic Set, Switch Binary Set, Scene Activation Set.
This parameter is used to restore the parameter 101, 102 and 103 to default setting.
When value==1, parameters 101 ~103 will be restored to default setting.When value==0, it will not restore any parameter.

name.lang: to set which report need to be sent.

description.lang: This parameter is used to configure which reports need to be sent in Report Group 1 (The possible values as below).

When value==1, which means the Voltage report is configured to be sent in Report Group 1. When value==2, which means the Current report is configured to be sent in Report Group 1. When value==4, which means the Wattage report is configured to be sent in Report Group 1. When value==8, which means the KWH report is configured to be sent in Report Group 1. When value==15, which means the Voltage , Current , Wattageand KWH report are all configured to be sent in Report Group 1. The other values will be reserved.

name.lang: to set which report need to be sent.

description.lang: This parameter is used to configure which reports need to be sent in Report Group 2 (The possible values as below).

When value==1, which means the Voltage report is configured to be sent in Report Group 2. When value==2, which means the Current report is configured to be sent in Report Group 2. When value==4, which means the Wattage report is configured to be sent in Report Group 2. When value==8, which means the KWH report is configured to be sent in Report Group 2. When value==15, which means the Voltage , Current , Wattageand KWH report are all configured to be sent in Report Group 2. The other values will be reserved.

name.lang: to set which report need to be sent.

description.lang: This parameter is used to configure which reports need to be sent in Report Group 3 (The possible values as below).

When value==1, which means the Voltage report is configured to be sent in Report Group 3. When value==2, which means the Current report is configured to be sent in Report Group 3. When value==4, which means the Wattage report is configured to be sent in Report Group 3. When value==8, which means the KWH report is configured to be sent in Report Group 2. When value==15, which means the Voltage , Current , Wattageand KWH report are all configured to be sent in Report Group 3. The other values will be reserved.
This parameter is used to restore the parameter 111, 112 and 113 to default setting.
When value==1, parameters 111 ~113 will be restored to default setting.

name.lang: Set the interval time of sending report.

description.lang: This parameter is used to set the interval time of sending report in Report Group 1.(The unit of time is second).
You have a wide range to set the interval time that can be set from 0 to 268435456 seconds.

name.lang: Set the interval time of sending report.

description.lang: This parameter is used to set the interval time of sending report in Report Group 2.(The unit of time is second).
You have a wide range to set the interval time that can be set from 0 to 268435456 seconds.

name.lang: Set the interval time of sending report.

description.lang: This parameter is used to set the interval time of sending report in Report Group 3.(The unit of time is second).
You have a wide range to set the interval time that can be set from 0 to 268435456 seconds.
This parameter is used to configure the partner ID.0== Aeon Labs Standard Product,1~255== others.
There are 255 different partners can be configured.
This parameter is used to Enable/Disable Lock all configuration parameters.(0 =disable, 1 = enable)
When value==0, all configuration parameters are configurable. When value==1, all configuration parameters are not configurable.(Locked).
This parameter is used to reset product to default factory setting.(There are just 2 values can be used)

When value==1431655765, it will reset the product to default factory setting and be excluded from Z-wave network. When value==1, it only will reset the all configuration parameters to default setting. The other values will be reserved.
This parameter is used for the overload protection, which means the load will be disconnected after 5 seconds when the current more than 39.5A.
0=disabled, 1=enabled

name.lang: Enable/Disable to send notifications to associated devices to associated devices

description.lang: This parameter is used to Enable/Disable to send notifications to associated devices (in Group 1) when the state of Heavy Duty Smart Switch Gen5s load is changed. (0=send nothing, 1=send hail CC, 2=send basic CC report).
(0=nothing, 1=hail CC, 2=basic CC report

name.lang: Enable/Disable the function of parameter 91 and 92

description.lang: This parameter is used to Enable/Disable the function of parameter 91 and 92 below (1=Enabled, 0=Disabled).
0=disabled, 1=enabled
This parameter is used to induce an automatic report when the change of the current power is more/less than the threshold in wattage.
The threshold can be set from 0 to 60000 watt.
This parameter is used to induce an automatic report when the change of the current power is more/less than the threshold in percentage.
The threshold can be set from 0 to 100 percent.
